summary: This document is a sealed application and order from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing a grand jury subpoena to Facebook, Inc. for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell's Instagram accounts. It includes a 365-day non-disclosure order to prevent Facebook from notifying Maxwell or others about the subpoena, citing concerns about jeopardizing the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signs the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying letter to Facebook, Inc. as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Sarah L. Cave
persons.context: Issues the § 2705(b) Non-Disclosure Order to Facebook, Inc., sealing the application and order.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subscriber associated with the Instagram accounts targeted by the grand jury subpoena. The application states the account holder is suspected of being involved in or associated with persons involved in the conduct under investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is authorizing the investigation and subpoena targeting Maxwell's social media accounts as part of a grand jury investigation.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena and Non-Disclosure Order
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office obtains a sealed court order and subpoena compelling Facebook, Inc. to produce records for Instagram accounts associated with Ghislaine Maxwell, with a 365-day gag order.

events.title: Subpoena Return Date
events.description: The date by which Facebook, Inc. is commanded to produce the requested records to the FBI, unless they submit them earlier to a specified Special Agent.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY
Facebook, Inc., 1601 Willow Road, Menlo Park, California 94025
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Facebook on December 11, 2019, seeking all records for any Instagram accounts registered to or associated with Ghislaine Maxwell.

A sealed court order prohibited Facebook from notifying Maxwell or anyone else about the subpoena for 365 days, citing concerns it would jeopardize the investigation by allowing targets to flee, tamper with evidence, or intimidate witnesses.
The investigation involved suspected violations of federal laws including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 371 (conspiracy), and 2423 (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity).
The application states the account holder (Maxwell) is 'suspected of being involved in or associated with persons involved in the conduct under investigation.'
The document reveals the government's use of 18 U.S.C. § 2705(b) to secretly obtain electronic records from service providers during sensitive investigations.
